text.0: One year after he ran into a burning home to help his neighbor, Baltimore’s Pierre Gibbons has received a Carnegie Medal from the Carnegie Hero Fund Commission. Learn how Johns Hopkins Burn Center doctors gave Gibbons a fighting chance at life.https://t.co/8fHmsDRS2m
text.1: Recognizing the signs of a #stroke and getting to the hospital quickly meant Althea got the clot busting medication tPA (tissue plasminogen activator), which saved her life. Watch her story here: https://t.co/H0zbsCluDf
text.2: The @hopkinskimmel at @sibleyonline gives patients with leukemia a treatment plan tailored to their individual case — from urgent care needs to relapsed and treatment-resistant cases — with input from physicians in various specialties. https://t.co/iYNHuBBHeP
text.3: More than 80,000 people in the U.S. are diagnosed each year with lymphoma, which occurs when disease-fighting immune cells grow and multiply uncontrollably. Patients can access the latest treatments at the @hopkinskimmel at @sibleyonline. https://t.co/LYWRwFyzqT
text.4:
Join the panel discussion: Future of the Surgical Space w/: Dr. L. Scott Levin, Chair of the ACS, Dr. @amyleecp3, EVP & Chief Clinical Officer - Providence & Dr. @AdralesG, Chief of Minimal Invasive #Surgery - @HopkinsMedicine
Register: https://t.co/luPqFaS4SZ
